title: To Sing Our Own Song: Philippines
subject_group: Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Philippines - Politics and government
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Diokno, Josae
description: Episode of Series "World about Us: Third Eye". One of a series of programs in which individuals describe the developing countries in which they live. Josae Diokno, former Secretary of Justice in the Philippines' government is a victim of his outspoken views. A leading intellectual figure of dissent in the Third World, he spent two years in jail for hostile criticism of the martial law imposed by President Marcos.
